briefTitle: Comparison of the Safety and Efficacy of Intravenous Iron Versus Oral Iron in the Treatment of Anemia Secondary to Heavy Uterine Bleeding
officialTitle: Comparison of the Safety and Efficacy of Intravenous Iron vs Oral Iron in the Treatment of Anemia Secondary to Heavy Uterine Bleeding
summary: This study compares of the safety and efficacy of intravenous iron vs oral iron in the treatment of anemia secondary to heavy uterine bleeding

primaryOutcome.measure: Number of Subjects Achieving 'Clinical Success'. Clinical Success is Defined as an Increase in Hemoglobin of â‰¥ 2.0 g/dL
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Any time between baseline and the end of study or time to intervention
